acknowledgments.summary: Mitsubishi Electric PSIRT reported these vulnerabilities to CISA.

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.text: All information products included in https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics are provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. DHS does not endorse any commercial product or service, referenced in this product or otherwise. Further dissemination of this product is governed by the Traffic Light Protocol (TLP) marking in the header. For more information about TLP, see https://us-cert.cisa.gov/tlp/.
notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow a local attacker to send files outside of the system as well as cause a denial-of-service condition.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage onus-cert.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

document.title: Mitsubishi Electric Factory Automation Engineering Software Products

product.name: MELSOFT iQ AppPortal: Versions 1.11M and prior
CPU Module Logging Configuration Tool: Versions 1.94Y and prior
MELSEC-L Flexible High-Speed I/O Control Module Configuration Tool: Versions 1.004E and prior

branches.name: MELSEC-L Flexible High-Speed I/O Control Module Configuration Tool

product.name: Motion Control Setting: Versions 1.005F and prior
EM Software Development Kit (EM Configurator): Versions 1.010L and prior

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference

notes.text: The vulnerability could allow a malicious attacker to send a file on the computer running the product to the outside.CVE-2020-5602 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 5.3 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Mitsubishi Electric recommends that affected users download the latest version of each software product from the following site and update it: https://www.mitsubishielectric.com/fa/#software
CPU Module Logging Configuration Too: Version 1.100E or later
EM Software Development Kit (EM Configurator): Version 1.015R or later
MELSEC-L Flexible High-Speed I/O Control Module Configuration Tool: Version 1.005F or later
MELSOFT iQ AppPortal: Version 1.14Q or later
Motion Control Setting: Version 1.006G or later

Make sure that the file is obtained from the correct acquisition route when users receive a project file or a configuration data file from another person via mail, USB memory, file server, etc. (Or, check that there is no file of unknown source.)
Operate the products under an account that does not have administrative privileges.
Install an antivirus software in your personal computer using the products.
Restrict network exposure for all control system devices or systems to the minimum necessary, and ensure that they are not accessible from untrusted networks and hosts.
Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolate them from the business network.
Use Virtual Private Network (VPN) when remote access is required.

notes.text: The vulnerability could allow a malicious attacker to cause the product to enter a denial-of-service condition.CVE-2020-5603 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
